channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Sequential Latent Variable Models for Few-Shot High-Dimensional Time-Series Forecasting
item.description: We compared the presented framework with a comprehensive set of baseline models trained 1) globally on the large meta-training set with diverse dynamics, and 2) individually on single dynamics, both with and without fine-tuning to k-shot support series used by the meta-models.

item.title: Controllable Visual-Tactile Synthesis
item.description: Deep generative models have various content creation applications such as graphic design, e-commerce, and virtual Try-on.

item.title: VendorLink: An NLP approach for Identifying & Linking Vendor Migrants & Potential Aliases on Darknet Markets
item.description: The anonymity on the Darknet allows vendors to stay undetected by using multiple vendor aliases or frequently migrating between markets.

item.title: PGB: A PubMed Graph Benchmark for Heterogeneous Network Representation Learning
item.description: Although graph mining research via heterogeneous graph neural networks has taken center stage, it remains unclear whether these approaches capture the heterogeneity of the PubMed database, a vast digital repository containing over 33 million articles.

item.title: Cuttlefish: Low-rank Model Training without All The Tuning
item.description: Cuttlefish leverages the observation that after a few epochs of full-rank training, the stable rank (i. e., an approximation of the true rank) of each layer stabilizes at a constant value.

item.title: Semantic Space Grounded Weighted Decoding for Multi-Attribute Controllable Dialogue Generation
item.description: Controlling chatbot utterance generation with multiple attributes such as personalities, emotions and dialogue acts is a practically useful but under-studied problem.

item.title: On the Expressivity Role of LayerNorm in Transformers' Attention
item.description: Layer Normalization (LayerNorm) is an inherent component in all Transformer-based models.

item.title: Efficient Personalized Federated Learning via Sparse Model-Adaptation
item.description: To overcome these challenges, we propose a novel approach named pFedGate for efficient personalized FL by adaptively and efficiently learning sparse local models.

item.title: RetroMAE-2: Duplex Masked Auto-Encoder For Pre-Training Retrieval-Oriented Language Models
item.description: It is designed to improve the quality of semantic representation where all contextualized embeddings of the pre-trained model can be leveraged.

item.title: Radiance Field Gradient Scaling for Unbiased Near-Camera Training
item.description: NeRF acquisition typically requires careful choice of near planes for the different cameras or suffers from background collapse, creating floating artifacts on the edges of the captured scene.

item.title: Semi-supervised Domain Adaptation via Prototype-based Multi-level Learning
item.description: At the inter-domain level, we propose a cross-domain alignment loss to help the model use the target prototype for cross-domain knowledge transfer.

item.title: Sentence Embedding Leaks More Information than You Expect: Generative Embedding Inversion Attack to Recover the Whole Sentence
item.description: In this work, we further investigate the information leakage issue and propose a generative embedding inversion attack (GEIA) that aims to reconstruct input sequences based only on their sentence embeddings.

item.title: Boundary-aware Backward-Compatible Representation via Adversarial Learning in Image Retrieval
item.description: For traditional model upgrades, the old model will not be replaced by the new one until the embeddings of all the images in the database are re-computed by the new model, which takes days or weeks for a large amount of data.

item.title: Aligning Bird-Eye View Representation of Point Cloud Sequences using Scene Flow
item.description: Such concatenation is possible thanks to the removal of ego vehicle motion using its odometry.

item.title: Masked Trajectory Models for Prediction, Representation, and Control
item.description: We introduce Masked Trajectory Models (MTM) as a generic abstraction for sequential decision making.

item.title: When Do Neural Nets Outperform Boosted Trees on Tabular Data?
item.description: Tabular data is one of the most commonly used types of data in machine learning.

item.title: ChatGPT-steered Editing Instructor for Customization of Abstractive Summarization
item.description: Tailoring outputs of large language models, such as ChatGPT, to specific user needs remains a challenge despite their impressive generation quality.

item.title: FUSegNet: A Deep Convolutional Neural Network for Foot Ulcer Segmentation
item.description: As the top decoder stage carries a limited number of feature maps, max-out scSE is bypassed there to form a shorted P-scSE.

item.title: Faithful Question Answering with Monte-Carlo Planning
item.description: In this paper, we propose FAME (FAithful question answering with MontE-carlo planning) to answer questions based on faithful reasoning steps.

item.title: Revisiting Graph Contrastive Learning for Anomaly Detection
item.description: In the paper, we delve into the misconception and propose Multi-GNN and Augmented Graph contrastive framework MAG, which unified the existing GCAD methods in the contrastive self-supervised perspective.

item.title: LatentAugment: Dynamically Optimized Latent Probabilities of Data Augmentation
item.description: Although data augmentation is a powerful technique for improving the performance of image classification tasks, it is difficult to identify the best augmentation policy.

item.title: "Oops, Did I Just Say That?" Testing and Repairing Unethical Suggestions of Large Language Models with Suggest-Critique-Reflect Process
item.description: Moreover, we propose a novel on-the-fly (OTF) repairing scheme that repairs unethical suggestions made by LLMs in real-time.

item.title: Self-Supervised 3D Scene Flow Estimation Guided by Superpoints
item.description: In our superpoint generation module, we utilize the bidirectional flow information at the previous iteration to obtain the matching points of points and superpoint centers for soft point-to-superpoint association construction, in which the superpoints are generated for pairwise point clouds.

item.title: Joint Graph Learning and Model Fitting in Laplacian Regularized Stratified Models
item.description: Laplacian regularized stratified models (LRSM) are models that utilize the explicit or implicit network structure of the sub-problems as defined by the categorical features called strata (e. g., age, region, time, forecast horizon, etc.

item.title: Personalize Segment Anything Model with One Shot
item.description: Driven by large-data pre-training, Segment Anything Model (SAM) has been demonstrated as a powerful and promptable framework, revolutionizing the segmentation models.

item.title: Panda LLM: Training Data and Evaluation for Open-Sourced Chinese Instruction-Following Large Language Models
item.description: This project focuses on enhancing open-source large language models through instruction-tuning and providing comprehensive evaluations of their performance.

item.title: Unsupervised Dialogue Topic Segmentation with Topic-aware Utterance Representation
item.description: Dialogue Topic Segmentation (DTS) plays an essential role in a variety of dialogue modeling tasks.

item.title: SuperNOVA: Design Strategies and Opportunities for Interactive Visualization in Computational Notebooks
item.description: Through this work, we identify unique design opportunities and considerations for future notebook VA tools, such as using and manipulating multimodal data in notebooks as well as balancing the degree of visualization-notebook integration.

item.title: ZipIt! Merging Models from Different Tasks without Training
item.description: While this works for models trained on the same task, we find that this fails to account for the differences in models trained on disjoint tasks.

item.title: Conditional and Residual Methods in Scalable Coding for Humans and Machines
item.description: We present methods for conditional and residual coding in the context of scalable coding for humans and machines.

item.title: Semantic-aware Generation of Multi-view Portrait Drawings
item.description: Our motivation is that facial semantic labels are view-consistent and correlate with drawing techniques.

item.title: Disentangled Contrastive Collaborative Filtering
item.description: Recent studies show that graph neural networks (GNNs) are prevalent to model high-order relationships for collaborative filtering (CF).

item.title: Adversarially-Guided Portrait Matting
item.description: We utilize this model to provide image-mask pairs for the StyleGAN3- based network (StyleMatteGAN).

item.title: Caption Anything: Interactive Image Description with Diverse Multimodal Controls
item.description: Controllable image captioning is an emerging multimodal topic that aims to describe the image with natural language following human purpose, $\textit{e. g.}$, looking at the specified regions or telling in a particular text style.

item.title: RCP-RF: A Comprehensive Road-car-pedestrian Risk Management Framework based on Driving Risk Potential Field
item.description: Recent years have witnessed the proliferation of traffic accidents, which led wide researches on Automated Vehicle (AV) technologies to reduce vehicle accidents, especially on risk assessment framework of AV technologies.

item.title: FedCBO: Reaching Group Consensus in Clustered Federated Learning through Consensus-based Optimization
item.description: Federated learning is an important framework in modern machine learning that seeks to integrate the training of learning models from multiple users, each user having their own local data set, in a way that is sensitive to data privacy and to communication loss constraints.

item.title: Understanding cirrus clouds using explainable machine learning
item.description: Their dependencies on meteorological and aerosol conditions are among the largest uncertainties in global climate models.

item.title: System Neural Diversity: Measuring Behavioral Heterogeneity in Multi-Agent Learning
item.description: When a system of learning agents is not constrained to homogeneous policies, individual agents may develop diverse behaviors, resulting in emergent complementarity that benefits the system.

item.title: Zenseact Open Dataset: A large-scale and diverse multimodal dataset for autonomous driving
item.description: Existing datasets for autonomous driving (AD) often lack diversity and long-range capabilities, focusing instead on 360{\deg} perception and temporal reasoning.

item.title: Causality-aware Concept Extraction based on Knowledge-guided Prompting
item.description: The prompt adopts the topic of the given entity from the existing knowledge in KGs to mitigate the spurious co-occurrence correlations between entities and biased concepts.

item.title: NorQuAD: Norwegian Question Answering Dataset
item.description: In this paper we present NorQuAD: the first Norwegian question answering dataset for machine reading comprehension.

item.title: Approximating CKY with Transformers
item.description: We investigate the ability of transformer models to approximate the CKY algorithm, using them to directly predict a parse and thus avoid the CKY algorithm's cubic dependence on sentence length.

item.title: Robust Natural Language Watermarking through Invariant Features
item.description: Recent years have witnessed a proliferation of valuable original natural language contents found in subscription-based media outlets, web novel platforms, and outputs of large language models.

item.title: FastAMI -- a Monte Carlo Approach to the Adjustment for Chance in Clustering Comparison Metrics
item.description: Clustering is at the very core of machine learning, and its applications proliferate with the increasing availability of data.

item.title: Towards the Decarbonization of the Mobility Sector: Promoting Renewable-Based Charging in Green Ride-Sharing
item.description: We propose a new mechanism to promote EV charging during hours of high renewable generation, and we introduce the concept of charge request, which is issued by a power utility company.

item.title: Scaling-up Remote Sensing Segmentation Dataset with Segment Anything Model
item.description: The success of the Segment Anything Model (SAM) demonstrates the significance of data-centric machine learning.

item.title: Lift Yourself Up: Retrieval-augmented Text Generation with Self Memory
item.description: In this paper, by exploring the duality of the primal problem: better generation also prompts better memory, we propose a framework called Selfmem, which iteratively adopts a retrieval-augmented generator itself to generate an unbounded memory pool and uses a memory selector to pick one generated memory for the next generation round.

item.title: A Lightweight CNN-Transformer Model for Learning Traveling Salesman Problems
item.description: Our model consumes approximately 20% less GPU memory usage and has 45% faster inference time compared with other state-of-the-art Transformer-based models.

item.title: Improving Contrastive Learning of Sentence Embeddings from AI Feedback
item.description: Our method utilizes AI feedback from large pre-trained language models (LLMs) to construct sample pairs with fine-grained sample similarity scores to improve contrastive learning.

item.title: The Benefits of Label-Description Training for Zero-Shot Text Classification
item.description: Large language models have improved zero-shot text classification by allowing the transfer of semantic knowledge from the training data in order to classify among specific label sets in downstream tasks.
